item.title: Another pot hole on the bridge, 8th January
item.description:
On the top of the railway bridge. It's clear there have been multiple potholes and attempts to fix them but there's a new one today. Please can someone fix them properly. Because it's on the bridge you can't avoid it!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple potholes on both sides of road, 8th January
item.description:
Potholes of varying sizes along both sides of north road west and several in the centre further up closer to the community centre. Too many to individually mark. Need surveying asap as you need to weave from side to side to avoid them
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): North Road West, Golden Valley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very large pothole on side of road, 8th January
item.description:
The pothole is approximately half way between the house and the farm on opposite side of road. Very large and getting bigger
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Badgeworth Road, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury

item.title: Drain blocked, 8th January
item.description:
Drain in Clarence Road near pittville gates, left hand side with traffic flow. This drain has been blocked for sometime and within 20 minutes of rain, flooding occurs on the road. This has been reported a number of times, so really needs attention to avoid serious damage to property.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clarence Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface problem, 8th January
item.description:
Customer reports that a vehicle has parked on the paving slabs at the location and dislodged/pushed them up around 2 inches. They are now a trip hazard and they are concerned for the safety of pupils at the nearby school.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Series of Dropped service drains, 8th January
item.description:
The dropped service drains along Station Road (between Huntsmans Meet and Waterside Close) continue to cause issues for residents on either side of the road with vibrations shaking properties when the larger vehicles (service buses) go over the drains. Motorists are also mentioning issues now, with several holes appearing on the drains.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Andoversford, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The drain is blocked problem, 8th January
item.description:
Drainage soakaway needs digging out under pavement or changing to channel in pavement . do i need permission Thank You John Rowland 01242 255414

item.title: Street Light Outage Opposite to 2 Cromwell Road, Innsworth, GL3 1FG, 8th January
item.description:
I am writing to report that the street light opposite my property at 2 Cromwell Road, Innsworth, Gloucester, GL3 1FG has been out of order for the past two months. This outage has created significant safety concerns during the evening and night, as the footpath and road are completely dark. The lack of lighting increases the risk of accidents, particularly slips caused by black ice, which is difficult to detect in the dark. Could you please arrange for this street light to be repaired as soon as possible? If you require any additional details, I am happy to provide them.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cromwell Road, Innsworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1,2, Gotherington Lane, Bishop's Cleeve
